metadata.note: Colorado uses a flat income tax rate. The rate can be temporarily reduced to 4.25% if certain revenue surplus triggers are met (2025-2035).

2025.note: Flat rate of 4.4% (can drop to 4.25% if revenue triggers met)

2024.note: Temporarily reduced to 4.25% per Senate Bill 24-228

notes: Colorado uses a flat tax rate, not progressive brackets
All taxable income above the standard deduction is taxed at the same rate
The rate applies to federal taxable income with Colorado-specific adjustments
For 2025-2035, the rate can drop to 4.25% if revenue surplus triggers are met
